How can I get paid during this time?
Any future payments that you receive from marketplaces, platforms and clients will not be affected by the freeze. You can sign in to view your funds, and you can now add your bank account for withdrawal of your future incoming payments.

categories:
Your Fiverr Experience
The Ranting Pot
thread_text:
06/30/2020 UPDATE: I am now able to use my Payoneer debit card, so it appears that as of 2:30 pm (GMT+2) my funds are unfrozen. Looking for confirmation from others as well.
CONFIRMED: Only users with balance linked to their Payoneer debit cards had their funds frozen. Withdraw to bank seems to work.
Users with NO physical card can use their funds as usual.
EDIT: Latest update from Payonerr courtesy of
@chupavix
:
https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.
reply_text: This means that in the event that Wirecard Card Solutions Ltd becomes insolvent Your funds may become valueless and unusable and as a result, You may lose Your money.

The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.
reply_text: There are intermediary companies that that transfer your money to Paypal for a fee

reply_text:
Ukraine’s history with PayPal is long, complex and painful one. There are a lot of reasons of why you can use it to give money but not to receive them, ranging from corruption and technical incompetence to political interests of a certain neighbouring country (depending on who you ask).
In any case, there are “creative” ways to get it done in some capacity. I’m not sure it’d be in line with fiverr’s ToS in particular but who knows, I gave up on researching PayPal Ukraine back in 2016 when the last and the most enthusiastic initiative to make it fully available tanked. All of this is just sad.

Paypal even discourages any transfer of money from someone’s account into the Paypal account of a relative. They are concerned about any sort of activity that could be related to money laundering… In other words people who might be trying illegal things. They freeze people’s accounts all the time and it’s unregulated.
The idea of withdrawing funds from fiverr to an account that isn’t yours is risky in several ways. But of course I understand the desperation simply to get your own money.

I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.

reply_text:
Maybe the solution for all users that have their Payoneer account linked to the Wirecard is to create new Payoneer account not linked to it. Then, change the Payoneer account at Fiverr, and use the method of
@queenmercedes
. However, it can be done only during Payoneer support operating hours, from Monday. Fiverr cannot unlink your Payoneer account. I’ve asked them for it once, and the support team said it can only be done using Payoneer support.
PLEASE, MIND THIS if you want to try this solution:
You can not have more than one Payoneer account linked your identity. If anyone does this without first closing their original account, they will risk losing both.
So you should create the second account only after speaking to Payoneer support, not at your sole discretion. Thanks for this update to
@cyaxrex

Users with NO physical card can use their funds as usual.
EDIT: Latest update from Payonerr courtesy of
@chupavix
:
https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.
reply_text:
This may be a nice solution for further Fiverr withdrawals!
Back in 2017, when there was another Payoneer issue, I had to change my account and I asked customer support to relink my Fiverr account. It was quite easy thing to do.

reply_text:
You can not have more than one Payoneer account linked your identity. If anyone does this without first closing their original account, they will risk losing both.
If you do close your original account first, you may not be able to recover any funds locked therein.
If you want to prove me wrong, ask Payoneer themselves and get an answer directly from them.

EDIT: Latest update from Payonerr courtesy of
@chupavix
:
https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.

reply_text: If you have a pioneer card, your money is frozen. New transfers you make to pioneer are going into your virtual balance, that is not affected by your card. Theoretically, Wirecard UK was legally bound to separate customer money from their own money and keep it safely in banks. The auditor froze their accounts to make sure they don’t siphon off those funds to Wirecard AG based in Germany. Let’s hope they played by the rules and our money is safely stored in reputable banks. Otherwise, we’re screwed.

06/30/2020 UPDATE: I am now able to use my Payoneer debit card, so it appears that as of 2:30 pm (GMT+2) my funds are unfrozen. Looking for confirmation from others as well.
CONFIRMED: Only users with balance linked to their Payoneer debit cards had their funds frozen. Withdraw to bank seems to work.
Users with NO physical card can use their funds as usual.
EDIT: Latest update from Payonerr courtesy of
@chupavix
:
https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.
reply_text:
ssj1236:
BTW, just checked and I could withdraw the $1k on my account but not the $5k that shows is on the card.
happybird614:
i am sorry to say that your statement is not on fact based. Funds are stuck and US$ are unable to withdraw in bank.
ssj1236 was successfully able to make a withdrawal. His funds on his card are not available.

reply_text:
Wirecard AG, a German payment processor and financial services provider that is listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange, filed for insolvency on Thursday 25th June 2020 due to an on-going scandal regarding a missing $2 Billion. The huge accounting scandal has seen its now ex CEO Markus Braun being arrested. The shockwaves from Wirecard AG’s crash has extended all over the world.
—technologytimes

EDIT: Latest update from Payonerr courtesy of
@chupavix
:
https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.
reply_text:
No, I get the part that everything that was on my Payoneer account up until yesterday’s afternoon is gone/inactive/frozen.
But if I’d, say, transferred a $1000 from fiverr to payoneer now, I’d still be able to withdraw that $1000 to the local bank even though I have the dang card attached and active? Well, “active” rather.
Again, sorry for being slow. Quite a lot got “frozen” but I’m more worried about not being able to withdraw any future revenue.

https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.

reply_text:
BaFin, Germany’s financial regulator, stepped in to prevent money from being deployed between Wirecard group entities, Wirecard group also has their own bank, BTW … (Wirecard Bank AG, with a full banking licence, so, in theory, regulated, (and “reputable” … I guess their reputation stats aren’t impressive right now …) Wirecard Bank’s customers’ funds should be protected up to €100.000, but that’s a different entity from Wirecard AG …)
Those finance groups are giant multi-leveled houses, or rather skyscrapers of cards.
My own online bank used Wirecard when it started, but has gained their own banking licence since, however, my main and very “reputable” bank belongs to a group of German lenders who have agreements in place to insure each others’ depositors if one of the banks runs into trouble, depositors’ nationality doesn’t matter. I think that’s specifically for Wirecard Bank AG, not Wirecard AG, but hopefully, there’ll be a solution and the funds can be unfrozen soon.
I hope Fiverr will look into offering a few more options now, so there won’t be users without any alternative when there are issues with one payment provider.

reply_text:
you can still use payoneer to transfer to your bank account. All transactions till work unless does to be done with the card.
What does this mean?
The FCA has communicated that they have taken these measures with the primary objective of protecting the interests and money of consumers who use Wirecard. Pending further actions from the FCA, you will temporarily be unable to withdraw the funds on your card, nor receive new payments onto your card.
Any funds that are in excess of the maximum balance of your card are held by Payoneer and are therefore not impacted by the FCA’s temporary freeze.
How can I get paid during this time?
Any future payments that you receive from marketplaces, platforms and clients will not be affected by the freeze. These funds, and any others already on your virtual currency balance, are available for bank withdrawal.

reply_text:
misscrystal:
I’m not sure what other company does what Payoneer does in the scope of all the countries it’s in.
Payoneer doesn’t do anything. What is revealed by this whole situation is that:
Payoneer doesn’t store your funds.
Payoneer doesn’t process transactions
Payoneer doesn’t issue prepaid debit cards
All Payoneer is, is a middle man brand that presents itself as doing all of the above, that really outsources everything to the cheapest service vendor. As such;
You can trust Payoneer to ignore 2-years of damning investagative reports into Wirecard and still throw your money at them.
You can trust that Payoneer will charge you higher fees than other companies doing the same thing, even though it uses the same payment processors.
You can rely on Payoneer to tell you everything is fine while the house is burning down, while updating their TOS to cover their own behind.
You can trust that while other payment providers linked to Wirecard like Revolut, will tell you what is going on and find a new payment processor in 24-hours, Payoneer will keep you hanging for as long as possible.
miiila:
I think Skrill (formerly MoneyBookers) is still in the market,
Skrill is still up and running. Also, my Wirex crypto debit card is still up and running, and apparently Revolut cards still work, despite them possibly having exposure to Wirecard.
As Skrill is already widely used on other freelance platforms, I hope Fiverr is actively looking into adding support here. While that solution won’t be perfect for everyone, it will take a lot of the pain away for many people while Fiverr looks at other solutions.

categories:
Your Fiverr Experience
The Ranting Pot
thread_text:
06/30/2020 UPDATE: I am now able to use my Payoneer debit card, so it appears that as of 2:30 pm (GMT+2) my funds are unfrozen. Looking for confirmation from others as well.
CONFIRMED: Only users with balance linked to their Payoneer debit cards had their funds frozen. Withdraw to bank seems to work.
Users with NO physical card can use their funds as usual.
EDIT: Latest update from Payonerr courtesy of
@chupavix
:
https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.
reply_text:
That’s a point, but you have to give your bank account number to companies you need to pay all the time, so I guess most people would be okay giving their number to a company they get money from, or would rather use a cheaper option, anyway, if possible.
But personally, yes, I agree, especially if that same company asks for a scan of your ID.
However, one should monitor one’s bank account closely in any case, as you never know where your data end up, and what happens, so you can revoke whatever seems fishy right away.

miiila:
you have to give your bank account number to companies you need to pay all the time
That’s a good point, it’s right on our checks. Hopefully any database it’s in is secure.
This whole thing is a wake up call showing just how vulnerable our entire money handling system is.
And it all depends on computer systems, and the internet.
I’ve had brief week long experiences with internet blackouts and electricity blackouts and it’s right back to living like a caveman pretty much. One may as well move to the woods and live in a tent.

I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.
reply_text: Yes, by Payonner. Both companies deals with money, not sure if they are in some sort of competition. Revolut also deals with crypto and that may be the main reason why it got rejected.

06/30/2020 UPDATE: I am now able to use my Payoneer debit card, so it appears that as of 2:30 pm (GMT+2) my funds are unfrozen. Looking for confirmation from others as well.
CONFIRMED: Only users with balance linked to their Payoneer debit cards had their funds frozen. Withdraw to bank seems to work.
Users with NO physical card can use their funds as usual.

reply_text:
Good news is Payoneer now has a feature that helps you transfer your money directly to your bank account. You must have at least $50 to do this. The money is sent to your account through one of their many partners and will appear in your local currency. The bad news is you may not be able to push funds from Fiverr to Payoneer at this time.
By my understanding, Payoneer let’s you access your funds through a WireCard Debit Card so that card is practically useless as things stand. Your funds are still safe in Payoneer but they may need to find some other card services provider. My guess, they are talking to the Mercury guys right now, who are by the way feeling over the moon right about now.

reply_text:
skydesigner:
And is it even possible to somehow transfer money from lets say
fiverr>paypal>Revolut or
fiverr>payone>Revolut
It’s possible, but you will have to pay the Paypal conversion fees unless you live in a country that has USD as its primary currency. I invest in stocks in USD in Revolut, so I’m forced to:
Get the money from Fiverr on Paypal in USD.
Convert in Paypal from USD to Euro
Get the Euro to Revolut
Convert in Revolut from Euro back to USD
And then I’m able to buy stocks.
It’s absurd. If Fiverr allowed direct transfers to Revolut, I would be making an extra 2.5% on all my earnings.

reply_text:
But the span of countries Payoneer serves is limited to the span of countries its actual card issuer (Wirecard) serves.
This being the case, Payoneer might have just lost its only USP…
If this is the case, this might have a bigger impact on Fiverr than most people realize. Lots of people can’t use PayPal and I don’t think it is rude to point out that the majority of new people signing up to use Fiverr are from countries where PayPal doesn’t operate. (At least by looking at the forum.)
If people can’t get paid anymore, they won’t hang around for long. That could impact Fiverr’s share price and overall competitiveness.

reply_text:
The problem is: a lot of freelancers are here because they have no other options. If Payoneer won’t make it, Fiverr will lose huge part of freelancers located in countries which don’t have PayPal, Revolut and other payment options. We choose Payoneer not because we like it, but because we have no other choice.
You can be 1000 times talented and willing to work hard, but with zero opportunities our countries give us (as well as zero **cks about it) we can’t make it.

thread_text:
06/30/2020 UPDATE: I am now able to use my Payoneer debit card, so it appears that as of 2:30 pm (GMT+2) my funds are unfrozen. Looking for confirmation from others as well.
CONFIRMED: Only users with balance linked to their Payoneer debit cards had their funds frozen. Withdraw to bank seems to work.
Users with NO physical card can use their funds as usual.
EDIT: Latest update from Payonerr courtesy of
@chupavix
:
https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.

reply_text:
I’m not going to risk listing countries only to get auto-flagged. However, there is a big continent beginning with A where humans evolved where PayPal is not supported and a few countries to the right of that continent where the British used to buy tea, teak, and spices, where PayPal isn’t available.
As for who has the largest market, I assume you mean most buyers are from the U.S. and EU. However, what makes Fiverr appealing to investors is the almost 35% they make from transactions. The more users Fiverr has, the more transactions investors see as being possible, meaning they want to see the platform growing in size in terms of sellers, not shrinking.
Plus, even if you have a few hundred freelancers in X country selling $5 logo gigs, etc, all that revenue adds up over time.

categories:
Your Fiverr Experience

thread_text:
06/30/2020 UPDATE: I am now able to use my Payoneer debit card, so it appears that as of 2:30 pm (GMT+2) my funds are unfrozen. Looking for confirmation from others as well.
CONFIRMED: Only users with balance linked to their Payoneer debit cards had their funds frozen. Withdraw to bank seems to work.
Users with NO physical card can use their funds as usual.
EDIT: Latest update from Payonerr courtesy of
@chupavix
:
https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.
reply_text:
You can have one credit card you use exclusively for business expenses. And some pay you a small percentage back up to 3% of all you spend in some cases. Chase credit cards are good for that if you have those there.
Do some research on “best credit cards” on google and choose wisely for best benefits.

thread_text:
06/30/2020 UPDATE: I am now able to use my Payoneer debit card, so it appears that as of 2:30 pm (GMT+2) my funds are unfrozen. Looking for confirmation from others as well.
CONFIRMED: Only users with balance linked to their Payoneer debit cards had their funds frozen. Withdraw to bank seems to work.
Users with NO physical card can use their funds as usual.
EDIT: Latest update from Payonerr courtesy of
@chupavix
:
https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.
reply_text: I made withdraw today first Payoneer give me error But Now successfully withdraw to my bank account!

reply_text:
No. It’s like a Ponzi scheme.
You say you have a lot of money when you don’t, to get other people to give you theirs. Then when people ask for their money back or just some of it, you give them some of the money given to you by someone else. It is only a matter of time before too many people want their money at once. Then the whole scheme comes crashing down, as it is revealed you have a lot less than you said you did.
On the upside,
@frank_d
@ssj1236
and all other affected users, I just found this article which is from a press release from Wirecard issued just a few hours ago:
marketscreener.com 17
Wirecard : informs customers and partners about current business operations |... 17
DGAP-News: Wirecard AG / Key word: Miscellaneous Wirecard AG informs customers and partners about current business operations 27.06.2020 / 16:08 The issuer is solely... | June 27, 2020
Depending on how you read this, it might allay some worries.
.

Wirecard Card Solutions Limited, headquartered in Newcastle, UK, has suspended its business operations due to an order issued by the competent supervisory authority, Financial Conduct Authority. The company has discussed measures with the authorities. The measures are being undertaken and will hopefully enable it to continue operations.
Hoping everyone gets their money back from Wirecard. It is a glimmer of hope but might take some time.

reply_text: I was able to withdraw my new funds too. I had around $200 available for withdrawal on my Fiverr account so I withdrew them to my card (no other option for me, and I used Bank Transfer which still loads money onto my card) and chose Immediate Load. Then I withdrew that amount manually into my local bank account and it went without a hitch, just like it used to. A few minutes later I got a notification from Payoneer that I received a payment. Of course I have yet to hear from my bank which will take afew days due to the weekend and a public holiday on Monday but it looks good so far. Not taking into account $5k frozen on my card.

reply_text:
sam_crawford:
Why is this Fiverr’s problem to solve?
Nothing ever is Fiverr’s problem to solve or even notify users about. That’s their problem.
Very few sellers use the forum. There will doubtless have been many people yesterday and there probably still are many people today, withdrawing their money to Payoneer, not realizing that they may not be able to access it when it arrives.
Whenever it has the opportunity,. Fiver loves to virtue signal itself to the extent that if you follow Fiverr on Twitter, you’d think it could walk on water and poop rainbows. Raising breast cancer awareness, being a champion for LGBT rights, celebrating inclusivity and women in the workplace, etc, etc.
However, when it comes the raw basics of being a freelancer like payment processing chaos, Fiverr can’t even be bothered to pin a post about major issues to its forum, let alone send out an email informing its users of disruption.

reply_text:
Hello fiverr community!
i am reading on fiverr forum that alot of users are worried for new withdrawal & not going to take risk for new payments withdraw.
Finally i taken a risk withdrawing new Funds from fiverr to payoneer. ( though i also got an email from payoneer that my card is blocked as it was issued by wirecard.) Fortunately i have only $2.31 on that & rest i have all moved to pakistani bank last day.
Btw. after new funds. your balance will split into 2 parts as shown below
So guys ! i taken a step to withdraw from payoneer! it shown on payoneer in 3-4 minutes & i choosen to load “Urgent for $3.00” . but unexpectedly after few minutes the fund was showing on my main balance.
After this i tried to withdraw to bank account but it started giving this error
then my balance got disappeared & the fiverr transaction again gone to “pending transaction” as it seem some glitch. After around 3-4 hours still it was pending. but then i installed payoneer app on my mobile & tried withdraw from mobile & it was showing full balance & new funds withdrawn successfully. but if i was trying to withdraw + $2.31 (old funds) it was showing the error of not enough funds.
Though its a glitch on payoneer dashboard that the transaction is still showing pending. & from website i can’t be able to withdraw funds but after withdraw from mobile app. the transaction still showing pending on website till now even that funds are already in my bank account few hours ago
glitch
1270×546 56.7 KB
So only the current funds are blocked & fresh funds are allowed for withdrawal. Hope so many users will find my story helpful.
We pray that payoneer solve this issue as we have no other way to withdraw money in pakistan.
Regards

reply_text:
frank_d:
If wirecard bank is A-OK but my funds are frozen, maybe my funds were controlled by Wirecard and not wirecard bank?!?
I think the point is that funds could possibly be on the dark side of the moon for all we know. (Where they are seems to be something no one wants to say for certain.) However, the UK has frozen all funds until Wirecard Card Solutions Limited can give the UK Financial Conduct Authority an assurance that funds are safe and will not be affected by whatever happens with other Wirecard entities.
I, therefore imagine that this might blow over (for now) if Wirecard Card Soilutions Limited can do something like the following:
Prove cash exists.
Prove that funds can not be confiscated by Wirecard creditors.
Prove that it can continue to perform normal business operations.
IF the above criteria can be satisfied, I imagine that this might be resolved quickly given that Wirecard itself is resuming operations.
However, I think there is an issue with the fact that people like myself still have funds going to Payoneer that are being credited to card accounts and not showing as available for bank withdrawal. This is because the UK FCA freeze prevents WCSL from performing any licensed activity while the freeze is in place.
Processing incoming transactions would constitute a licensed financial activity, at least that’s how I see it.

It’s so unusual. I’ve never come across anything like this. Companies that handle people’s pay and money aren’t supposed to have this happen. And it’s on a global scale affecting millions of people.
How does it happen? It seems impossible. What would have happened if they didn’t freeze the accounts? Is it really a ponzi scheme? I can’t wait to hear more details.
Don’t hold substantial money in a revenue card. It’s not protected. This is the only time I’ve ever heard of a revenue card. It’s like a debit card but it’s not. It’s different. Risky.
It sounds like it’s for people who don’t have a bank account. Or maybe for people who don’t want to put their money in their bank account.

reply_text:
It’s confusing for sure. Basically, there’s 3 entities involved:
Wirecard AG (Aschheim (Munich), Germany), the parent company,
and the daughter companies
Wirecard Bank AG (Germany)
Wirecard Solutions Limited (Newcastle, UK)
The parent company filed for insolvency, the daughter companies not (yet), and should theoretically be able to continue operation, however, it’s “constantly being reviewed whether daughter companies should file for insolvency too”.
Just read that Skrill is among all the products that use the Wirecard infrastructure, too, by the way, so that wouldn’t have been an alternative to Payoneer right now, also Curve, Boon, Laterpay, Bluecard, Transferwise (was listed, but according to info in a below post, they moved away from Wirecard in 2018), Aldi, … use Wirecard. Aldi, for instance, has contracts with Wirecard Bank AG, not with Wirecard Solutions Ltd., though, and is thus not affected (for now), their gift cards that work via Wirecard Bank AG work, but all cards, etc. that use Wirecard Solutions Ltd., don’t, as the authority in charge (UK’s FCA, as Wirecard Solutions Ltd. is based in Newcastle, UK) stopped their businesses, so investigations can be conducted, etc.
I guess everything, and any infos are just temporary for now, and business is supposed to go on for now, too, alongside the fraud investigations and all that, a “temporary insolvency administrator” (yes, temporary, again) has been appointed to evaluate the survival capability of the company. Apparently, there are also already companies interested in buying, the stocks even regained a bit, though, of course, they are still very much down.
A real cluster…, in any case.

categories:
Your Fiverr Experience
The Ranting Pot
thread_text:
06/30/2020 UPDATE: I am now able to use my Payoneer debit card, so it appears that as of 2:30 pm (GMT+2) my funds are unfrozen. Looking for confirmation from others as well.
CONFIRMED: Only users with balance linked to their Payoneer debit cards had their funds frozen. Withdraw to bank seems to work.
Users with NO physical card can use their funds as usual.
EDIT: Latest update from Payonerr courtesy of
@chupavix
:
https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.

Yes, might be a case of too big to let them fail, or too tasty to not vulture them, and people’s memories aren’t much better than their attention spans, and why distrust a company, if one or two bad guys have been found guilty and gotten rid of, or fled, but if needed, they can always just “reinvent” it, regroup, slap a new name on it and have a phoenix from the ashes, or a shiny brand new fintech, depending what the marketing department thinks fits the taste du jour better.
Who bought Lehman Brothers back then, Barclays and Nomura? Maybe they have some spare pocket money laying around, unless they heavily invested in airlines or cruise ships last year.
Corona, Analytics N/A, Payoneer Blackout … 2020 is a veritable Pandora’s Box of surprises, and we still have half a year to go. What will be next?

reply_text:
jberba1:
Why doesn’t Fiverr just buy them…
Buying shares isn’t the same as buying a company dirt cheap after the liquidators arrive. Shares are just financial instruments that give you sway over decision making if you have enough. Buying Wirtecard outright would also mean taking on whatever Wirecard’s liabilities are. Pensions, wages, rents, infrastructure costs, etc.
It’s not exactly the kind of thing you do lightly.

My guess is he’s made bank long before now, and already has a yacht waiting to whisk him off to somewhere tropical when the dust settles.

categories:
Your Fiverr Experience
The Ranting Pot
thread_text:
06/30/2020 UPDATE: I am now able to use my Payoneer debit card, so it appears that as of 2:30 pm (GMT+2) my funds are unfrozen. Looking for confirmation from others as well.
CONFIRMED: Only users with balance linked to their Payoneer debit cards had their funds frozen. Withdraw to bank seems to work.
Users with NO physical card can use their funds as usual.
EDIT: Latest update from Payonerr courtesy of
@chupavix
:
https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.
reply_text:

Apple, Visa, American Express, Discover, and more like these. Victims.

reply_text:
Update from Payoneer:
We understand that the developing situation with Wirecard has created a lot of concern and challenges for Payoneer Prepaid Mastercard® card users. We have been assured by the FCA that the freeze was put in place to ensure the protection of all cardholders’ funds. We have also been given repeated reassurances that all funds are properly safeguarded. Progress is being made to lift the freeze, and we will continue to update you as soon as more information is available. This situation has impacted the customers of many companies, and we believe that it will be resolved soon.
In the meantime, incoming funds to Payoneer users can be withdrawn to bank accounts or held in a Payoneer Account which remains safe and secure. All funds held in Payoneer are fully liquid and available and held in global leading banks. Our company is strong and stable, and committed to safeguarding our customers’ funds in accordance with all relevant global regulations.
We know that our customers depend on these funds, and that this freeze has created hardships for many people. We have enabled alternative solutions for payment withdrawal and are working to address any technical issues that have come up, and to help our customers in any way we can.
Fiverr is in close contact with Payoneer until this issue is resolved. Will post updates here if there are any developments. For now, I’ll keep this topic open to discuss issues, but please keep the conversation on topic.

Update about my Wirecard Transactions!
I am one of Payoneer Wirecard holder, after following this thread, I transferred my money from Fiverr to Payoneer!
I chosen immediately fund release option at Payoneer
My payment got credited into payoneer card within 2 minutes
Then I transferred it to my Pakistan bank account
And finally I got money into my Pakistani bank account within less then 30 minutes
Learned, there is no freeze on upcoming transactions! Those who still waiting for confirmation about doing or not doing transaction from Fiverr to Payoneer, please do it now, even if you’re Wirecard holder, in my experience there is no issue.

https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.

reply_text:
I’m a bit surprised at how fiverr is handling this. ‘Cause u p w o r k has been sending emails and clarifications for days to try and calm people down and assist them with managing their upcoming payments. Yet, fiverr seems to be pushing the narrative that a very small percentage of people has been affected, thus this doesn’t require an official statement of any sort. And it’s just, well, surprising. And a bit heartbreaking.
A Payoneer representative from yesterday’s video (scroll up if you’re curious, there’s a link) seemed to be adamant that it’ll get resolved as soon as possible and we should expect major positive developments Monday-Tuesday. I personally have cash resources and am willing to wait for a month at the very least.

CONFIRMED: Only users with balance linked to their Payoneer debit cards had their funds frozen. Withdraw to bank seems to work.
Users with NO physical card can use their funds as usual.
EDIT: Latest update from Payonerr courtesy of
@chupavix
:
https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.
reply_text: It’s very amusing if that’s what it is. And it’s very reassuring as well! Keeps everyone calm and from going into a panic. I hope he or she keeps it up.

reply_text:
Yup. Nothing makes me calmer than realizing that 50% of everything that I have to my name is stuck between a payment processor that may or may not be falling apart and a platform isn’t too keen to address the situation. It’s been a rough couple of days.
I mean, kudos to them if they know something reassuring that I don’t and try to communicate it to me in subtle ways like this but there is no way to know for sure.

reply_text:
Some of us don’t have a choice. It’s a risk and as long as you know that it is and take the necessary precautions to minimize impact, it’s fine. I do wish I’d take more precautions but I’ve been preoccupied with this whole covid situation and I can’t be paranoid about 2 things at the same time.
Plus, Payoneer has been great to me when I had fraudulent charge issues a few years back. They handled it swiftly and CS has been delightful to talk to.

reply_text:
I like this update video best so far. Women are way better than men at calming situations, providing it’s not a Friday evening in Newcastle Upon Tyne.
I also just found this article, which has left me a bit stumped:
markets.businessinsider.com 13
Wirecard is 'beyond salvageable,' according to one analyst, who says the... 13
Munich-based Wirecard, founded in 1999, was established with the intention of assisting websites with credit card payment collections from custo...
Specifically, this bit here:
“Yes there could be scraps for Adyen, Square and PayPal to pick up but do you really think Wirecard has 300,000 paying customers as they claimed? There never was €1.9 billion.”
To me, it is obvious that Wireard should have had way more than 300,000 users. I mean, just think of all the freelaners using Payoneer, then there is the even bigger online gambling market that Skrill serves, as well as other online banks and payment processors.

I have a card but I never used it, just once for online buying. 2 years ago if I had knowledge at the start that I can even withdraw my money through a local bank, I would never have ordered this card. People like me are in big trouble this time here because Paypal is not available in our country. I heard and also did read in Payoneer’s email that the money which we will send now after that frozen money, we would be able to withdraw that through our local bank. But still, some Fiverr sellers are saying that they sent more money after the frozen money and that money also got stuck.
frank_d:
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
Thanks for the advice. I will follow this. But can you please let me know what if this investigation takes up to months? Because this is a matter of billions, then in that case, what do you think what we people here can do where Paypal is also not available?

categories:
Your Fiverr Experience
The Ranting Pot
thread_text:
06/30/2020 UPDATE: I am now able to use my Payoneer debit card, so it appears that as of 2:30 pm (GMT+2) my funds are unfrozen. Looking for confirmation from others as well.
CONFIRMED: Only users with balance linked to their Payoneer debit cards had their funds frozen. Withdraw to bank seems to work.
Users with NO physical card can use their funds as usual.
EDIT: Latest update from Payonerr courtesy of
@chupavix
:
https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.
reply_text:
sunnykingkoh:
what do you think what we people here can do where Paypal is also not available?
Hopefully, some alternative solution becomes available sooner than later. There are way too many of us.

lenasemenkova:

Thanks for the hope!
I don’t think there would be any solution sooner from the Payoneer side because it will resolve when the investigation would be complete and its a matter of billions therefore I guess, it may take up to months.
Yes, there are millions of their users affected this time and they must be secure our money (which is being frozen) and return it back to us as soon as possible. In case, if they do not return our money then how people can trust a company anymore who could not even secure their users’ hard-earned money! But I believe that they would be doing their best to resolve this issue as soon as possible.
For now, Fiverr should take some action and should provide us an alternate so that the users which are in those countries where Paypal is not available, can withdraw their amounts from the Fiverr.

It has been said several times already:
Withdrawing new funds to your bank account via Payoneer still works.
Your card’s funds are frozen and if you withdraw funds to your card it’s instead added to your Payoneer’s account balance.
You can only withdraw said balance if you link a bank account.

thread_text:
06/30/2020 UPDATE: I am now able to use my Payoneer debit card, so it appears that as of 2:30 pm (GMT+2) my funds are unfrozen. Looking for confirmation from others as well.
CONFIRMED: Only users with balance linked to their Payoneer debit cards had their funds frozen. Withdraw to bank seems to work.
Users with NO physical card can use their funds as usual.
EDIT: Latest update from Payonerr courtesy of
@chupavix
:
https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.
reply_text:
happybird614:
It means i can get new funds and only these new funds will be in a position to withdrawal in my bank account.
Your Fiverr account is new, created this month, with no sales and no active gigs. So you’re definitely not withdrawing anything from that account, to Payoneer or elsewhere.
Do you have more than one Fiverr account, or are you working via another freelancing platform, and have joined Fiverr (and Fiverr forum) hoping to get more information about the issue?

reply_text:
Update 29 June
Following last week’s news of €1.9 billion missing from the accounts of the German company, Wirecard, we placed requirements on the firm’s UK business so that it should stop carrying out regulated activities and not pay out or reduce any money it holds. Our primary objective all along has been to protect the interests and money of consumers who use Wirecard.
Teams from across the FCA have been working with the firm, and other international and UK authorities, over the weekend, and we have seen good progress by the firm in meeting the conditions we set.
We are maintaining pressure on the firm to resolve these issues which would allow it to operate under certain conditions. However, we cannot lift the restrictions without reassuring ourselves that the firm has been able to satisfy all our concerns for example that all clients’ money is safe. We hope to be able to issue an update soon.
FCA – 26 Jun 20 6
Requirements have been imposed on Wirecard’s authorisation 6
Wirecard Card Solutions Limited (FRN 900051) is authorised and supervised by the FCA to issue e-money and provide payment services including, issuing e-money onto prepaid cards. Wirecard is authorised under the Electronic Money Regulations 2011 (the...

reply_text:
whitebrdanimatr:
I’m considering to pause all of my gigs
To be honest, I am too. Today is one of those days where I have orders to do that take far more time than they should because of unworkable requirements and buyers who have no idea how to communicate.
My logical brain says I should cancel these and spend my time instead working on promoting myself on other platforms. As it is, though, I’ve decided to push through until Wednesday or Friday. If there is noi resolution by then, I’ll start making my great migration.
I base this on Payoneer playing heavily on the idea that my frozen funds in Payoneer are safe and that this problem will be remedied quickly. If it gets to Friday and there is still no solution available, I’ll consider this nothing more than PR hogwash and move on.
Maybe consider setting yourself a similar deadline.

reply_text:
Fiverr’s strategy seems to be: “It doesn’t affect an overwhelming majority of people so we’re not going to address it at all”. Which is unfortunate because if there is no widespread problem, there is no urgent need for alternative payment solutions.
I get that the direct bank transfer seems to be working fine FOR NOW. However, we still don’t know how all of this will affect Payoneer in the future and I’m not exactly itching to go anywhere near the payment options that are still facilitated by it. What I’ve heard from them so far is PR speak and it’s never as reassuring as they hope it to be.
I personally turned on a vacation mode for a few days. I wasn’t planning to but two buyers I had over the weekend chose to be difficult at this worst possible moment and while I’ve dealt and still am dealing with them, I’m not exactly in the mood for any more difficulties if they are to come.
I’m still in talks and accept orders from my regulars and new people who contacted me before all of this went down so my profile is still active and going. So I probably wouldn’t advise on going completely dark. But if you want a few days off to deal with the stress, I don’t think there is anything wrong with that.

https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.
reply_text:
frank_d:
To be honest I’ve lost 98% of my motivation since Friday,
Yep. Mine pretty much flat-lined with today’s FCA update.

reply_text:
I’ve been in a similar situation but in that case I went for three weeks without being able to get any of my earnings at all, yet still had to work on orders. There was no one reassuring me it would be ok either. It seemed for those three weeks I would never be able to withdraw my earnings again. I finally found the solution on my own without any help.
So keep on working and at least you are able to withdraw all earning that aren’t stuck on the card. Don’t give up.

reply_text:
lenasemenkova:
I’m not exactly itching to go anywhere near the payment options that are still facilitated by it. What I’ve heard from them so far is PR speak and it’s never as reassuring as they hope it to be.
This is exactly why I’m hesitant and worried too.
lenasemenkova:
I’m still in talks and accept orders from my regulars and new people who contacted me before all of this went down so my profile is still active and going. So I probably wouldn’t advise on going completely dark. But if you want a few days off to deal with the stress, I don’t think there is anything wrong with that.
Yeap, I’m keeping my cool and doing all of my orders as usual. But I’m really considering to go offline for few days. “Vacation mode” is a good suggestion ! Thanks !
cyaxrex:
My logical brain says I should cancel these and spend my time instead working on promoting myself on other platforms. As it is, though, I’ve decided to push through until Wednesday or Friday. If there is noi resolution by then, I’ll start making my great migration.
I have something in my mind too. This whole situation is a wake up call for me. I need to work on promoting myself on other platforms. Good Luck for your orders ! I’m getting strange buyers as well.
frank_d:
@whitebrdanimatr
to be clear: I didn’t suggest that things are A-OK now, or that you can feel at ease. I merely mentioned it as a temporary measure, just so you can complete the current set of orders and not lose that money as well.
I know right. I’m just considering to pause for future orders. But I think,
@lenasemenkova
has given a reasonable suggestion to take off for few days.

thread_text:
06/30/2020 UPDATE: I am now able to use my Payoneer debit card, so it appears that as of 2:30 pm (GMT+2) my funds are unfrozen. Looking for confirmation from others as well.
CONFIRMED: Only users with balance linked to their Payoneer debit cards had their funds frozen. Withdraw to bank seems to work.
Users with NO physical card can use their funds as usual.
EDIT: Latest update from Payonerr courtesy of
@chupavix
:
https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.
reply_text:
Well, Payoneer was flirting with rumors about an IPO earlier this year. If I was them, I’d capitalize on this crisis by setting a date and announcing plans for Payoneer to start issuing its own cards.
Grtanted, all that is easier said than done. However, I think after this few people are going to trust any company that doesn’t issue their own cards.

reply_text:
Can I use the EU Payment Service at this time?
“Yes, the EURO recipient accounts are not affected and work normally. You can continue using them to receive payments in EURO, and the funds will be deposited into your Payoneer balance as usual. Our EUR payment service is issued by Wirecard Bank in Germany, which is unrelated to the current situation with the UK card company. We are communicating with the regulator in Germany, which operates the banking business as usual. In parallel, we are working with Citi Bank to issue you an alternative EURO receiving account as soon as possible. We are also coordinating with our market partners to ensure that you can change it smoothly. We will update it as soon as it is available.”
Can I withdraw funds from my virtual Payoneer balance to my bank account?
“Yes, any fund in your virtual balance can be withdrawn to your bank account.
from de-reviews

I’m going to use Payoneer forever and ever and ever.

The Ranting Pot
thread_text:
06/30/2020 UPDATE: I am now able to use my Payoneer debit card, so it appears that as of 2:30 pm (GMT+2) my funds are unfrozen. Looking for confirmation from others as well.
CONFIRMED: Only users with balance linked to their Payoneer debit cards had their funds frozen. Withdraw to bank seems to work.
Users with NO physical card can use their funds as usual.
EDIT: Latest update from Payonerr courtesy of
@chupavix
:
https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.
reply_text:
A new video from Payoneer, in case anyone is interested.
Statement from Payoneer CEO, Scott Galit

Payoneer offering to reimburse everyone out their own pockets is a bold move!
However, while I am appreciative of that, I don’t think it is a smart one. I imagine lots of people are going to withdraw their funds and run as soon as they can.
That said, if this does happen, I would probably feel safer continuing to use Payoneer.

Well, he attempted a reassuring smile at 1:21.
I’ll, in turn, attempt to be cautiously optimistic about this.
PS I lost an equivalent of £300 due to a fraudulent charge once. Payoneer did take care of it but I was warned that a procedure like this would take 3-4 months. It ended up being closer to 3 months in the end. I realize that £300 is nowhere near the losses we’re looking at now but they took care of it when I didn’t quite expect them to.

Message from Payoneer:
We’re writing to address today’s news 4 that the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) has lifted the freeze on Wirecard Card Solutions Limited (WCSL) at 00.01 UK on 30 June 2020. This means that users can once again access their funds currently held on their Payoneer Prepaid Mastercard® Card, withdraw them at an ATM or spend online and in-store. Furthermore, from Monday 6 July, cardholders will once again be able to withdraw their funds to their local bank account.
All future payments that you send will continue to be received to your payees’ Payoneer currency balance. There is NO effect on your regular disbursements to your payees. You can continue submitting payments via our API and our admin console regularly. These funds are available to your payees to be withdrawn to their local bank account or to be used with any of our other services.

thread_text:
06/30/2020 UPDATE: I am now able to use my Payoneer debit card, so it appears that as of 2:30 pm (GMT+2) my funds are unfrozen. Looking for confirmation from others as well.
CONFIRMED: Only users with balance linked to their Payoneer debit cards had their funds frozen. Withdraw to bank seems to work.
Users with NO physical card can use their funds as usual.
EDIT: Latest update from Payonerr courtesy of
@chupavix
:
https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.
reply_text:
These funds are available to your payees to be withdrawn to their local bank account or to be used with any of our other services.
It means it’s over and working as it should. The freeze has been lifted.
This means that users can once again access their funds currently held on their Payoneer Prepaid Mastercard® Card, withdraw them at an ATM or spend online and in-store.

reply_text:
tproud:
Not that I was staying up and biting my nails
So far, I’m down to the wrist bone.
Possibly, though, we should cut Payoneer some slack and give them a day or so to get things up and running fully.
Right now, millions of people are going to be attempting to use Wirecards and Wirecard related services simultaneously to get their cash. This is going to put major pressure on every related payment provider. and Wirecard’s payment network.
As the FCA in the UK has made things official now, we should maybe relax and just wait for the dust to settle.

tproud:
For some reason I feel more tense than before. No instant gratification then.
You should try trading Bitcoin. You can go from I’m rich elation to the back of a food bank queue quicker than you can say whoops.
I only traded briefly, but it was enough to make me immune to things like payment delays.
As Payoneer has guaranteed all of our funds anyway, we are pretty safe.
Also, Payoneer hasn’t actually sent out official emails yet to let everyone know what the current status of things are. So far, all we have is social media and PR people repeating what the FCA has said. As this news broke in the very late evening, it is possible that some technical wizardry has to go on behind the scenes that might not get attended to until tomorrow.

reply_text:
Yeah, I suspected they might have got a heads up and worked a bit of PR magic. (Very smart, I would do the same).
In either case, the FCA says:
We continue to monitor Wirecard’s activities closely and certain requirements continue to remain in force. These should not, however, affect the services Wirecard provides to its customers. This means customers can now or very shortly use their cards as necessary.
I think the words now or very shortly mean that it is reasonable to expect things will not go back to normal instantly.

@chupavix
:
https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.

reply_text:
Will I be able to access the funds on my card?
Yes, you’ll be able to withdraw the funds on your card from an ATM or spend them online and in-store . While you may wish to quickly withdraw your funds, the FCA has assured us that no further problems are expected.
From 00:01 CET on Monday, July 6th , you will once again be able to withdraw your funds to your local bank account and use the Make a Payment and Manage Currencies services . Until then, we will waive ATM withdrawal fees.
Will I be able to receive new funds to my card?
All future payments will continue to be received to your Payoneer currency balance, not your card . Even though the FCA announced that the cards are safe to use, we will offer a new card issuer soon to ensure the long-term safety of your earnings.
from Payoneer blog

reply_text:
I wouldn’t try too often. Too many data collected and passed around, and it’s possible that all the card declinations affect your credit score. Shouldn’t, of course, but might be a case like that cancellations on Fiverr affect you (unless you go through support and can present them a good enough reason, and even then they may not affect your completion rate but your ranking ) never mind if it was your fault or not.
Maybe there are error codes that tell the software it’s not your fault, but who knows, I’d rather wait until the 24 hours/6 days/8 days are over, or at least not try too often, and for unimportant stuff. If the card is your only way to pay for food, that’s another affair, of course.

reply_text:
misscrystal:
Wirecard never realized the top executive at Wirecard was falsely telling everyone they had 2 billion dollars they never had. No one bothered to check that out
They actually had audited accounts by EY (Earnst Young) who are one of the the biggest auditors around. They signed off on all accounts until 2018. The Financial Times investigated and found that many transactions were being passed through shell companies with no actual employees so they investigated further. EY finally refused to sign off last year (maybe even reported it) and that’s when the investigation by law enforcement was triggered.
It seems that the 2bn in question was listed as being in a bank that had never dealt with Wirecard. EY never checked with that bank before. EY is also being investigated as a result of this. If they are found to have been negligent or anything worse, then there’s going to be a lot of companies being readudited. Being one of the (if not the) biggest auditors, this could be a story that runs and runs (not affecting Payoneer, they seem to have dealt with things well).

categories:
Your Fiverr Experience
The Ranting Pot
thread_text:
06/30/2020 UPDATE: I am now able to use my Payoneer debit card, so it appears that as of 2:30 pm (GMT+2) my funds are unfrozen. Looking for confirmation from others as well.
CONFIRMED: Only users with balance linked to their Payoneer debit cards had their funds frozen. Withdraw to bank seems to work.
Users with NO physical card can use their funds as usual.
EDIT: Latest update from Payonerr courtesy of
@chupavix
:
https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.
reply_text:
That’s a great summary of what mostly went wrong and why it took so long for people to catch on
@eoinfinnegan

reply_text:
LATEST UPDATE
The FCA, which regulates Wirecard Card Solutions in the UK, completed their audit and lifted the freeze. After a short time during which Mastercard addressed technical restrictions on their side, your Payoneer Prepaid Mastercard is active once again. You can now withdraw funds from your card at ATMs or spend them online or in stores. We are also in the process of enabling you once again to withdraw your funds to your local bank account and use your balance to make payments. These services will be reactivated on Monday July 6th. We know that this period has been difficult for you. We appreciate your patience and support while we worked hard to bring this situation to a resolution.

EDIT: Latest update from Payonerr courtesy of
@chupavix
:
https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.

reply_text:
freelanceplus1:
If I may, why do you detest withdrawing to your bank account?
For me, it’s not possible. My bank is in the UK and I live in Malta. The last time I tried to add my bank, I was told it needed to be one where I live (a Malta bank, not a bank abroad.)
I have the same problem with PayPal. I opened my account in New Zealand and can only deposit funds to a NZ bank account which I have but haven’t used for years. Temporarily, I used PayPal in Europe when I lived in Hungary (via a new account). However, with that too, I can only withdraw money to a Hungarian bank.
To withdraw to a bank now, I will have to open a new account in Malta which is difficult as they want to see an employment contract and proof of earnings. Last time I gave up trying.
The only reason I use Payoneer is because I like the convenience of it and the fact that I don’t have to go through the process of opening new bank accounts and PayPal accounts every time I move. I just go to where I want to be and it works.

I’ve officially ended my relationship with Payoneer. I spoke to one of their reps today and they said their mastercard won’t be accepting anymore new payloads. Meaning any new funds will have to be extracted via bank account. Until Payoneer finds a new card issuer.
So I basically told them to close my account. It makes absolutely no sense that they’re not allowing customers to use their cards until they strike a deal with a new issuer.
Luckily, I have a paypal cash card on the way which I’ll be using as my debit card in the future. I had one already, but it expired due to inactivity.

:

Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.

reply_text:
I understand, but they will get a new issuer soon. You can’t load the Wirecard issued Payoneer card again, and it makes sense because they are moving out and finding another partner they can trust and have the assurance of not getting burnt like WC.
No need to close your account. Remember the saying, "Be careful the bridges you burn, you may need to cross them again."
Paypal’s horror stories scare me like hell.

reply_text:
nickj2013:
Meaning any new funds will have to be extracted via bank account. Until Payoneer finds a new card issuer.
It’s not the most convenient way because it involves a lot of additional movements. Their card was useful in many ways. I could just withdraw the required amount, pay taxes and forget about it.
Payoneer cards were banned in Russia because Payoneer refused to register with local tax authorities (at the same time, PayPal managed to register in a proper way).
Here are the main problems I faced since May:
It’s impossible to get your money during long holidays and weekends.
The largest state bank rejects Payoneer payments because they use strange payment descriptions, which trigger security systems. The largest private bank does the same.
Payoneer customer support has no idea about the process of money withdrawal. When you ask them about the information provided to the bank, they say: “It’s only your name.” When I showed them screenshots below, they were like: “Well, maybe it’s not your name. We have a lot of partners, so there’s no way to know it.”
In fact, it says the following:

(Foreign exchange transaction 20200 (Payment for services), VAT has to be paid separately).
And this:

The payment was made by Citibank Ireland (with a lot of , after it).
There were no issues when they used the following description:
For now, I have to switch to PayPal with their rates and fees…

reply_text:
Here in the U.S. which is where I am based, as far as I know about Paypal’s debit card, the only fees come from of course ATM (which is actually cheaper than Payoneer at $1.50 per withdrawal), and cash reload fee of $3.95. Which is when you reload cash onto your card at a retailer like CVS, Walgreens, 7-Eleven, etc. I don’t do the latter, so no worries.
Also paypal instant transfers to my paypal debit card cost me $0.25 per transfer. Money arrives in 30 minutes or less. Again, cheaper than Payoneer’s $3.00 per immediate load.

reply_text:
nickj2013:
Paypal’s debit card
They don’t offer it here. It was available a couple of years ago, but they closed all cards here.
When you transfer USD to PayPal, you lose around 5% on exchange rate. There’s no way to use USD, so I have to exchange it.
In addition, they take 3-4% per withdrawal. So, I lose around 8-9%, which is a lot.
They have only one advantage: They are registered with tax authorities, and I can be sure that my funds won’t be held by the foreign exchange control.
In the case of Payoneer, I have to talk with the bank representatives once in a while, and I never know if my payment is processed immediately or in a week.
At the same time, I hope they will find a solution to offer debit cards here.

Just saw this on Facebook, it’s official statement from Payoneer:
“Good news! You’re now able to withdraw the funds on your card to your local bank account, make payments and manage currencies. While we previously communicated that this would become available on Monday, July 6th, we listened to your feedback and worked hard to make it happen. Furthermore, while new funds will continue to be received to your Payoneer currency balance, we’re gradually transitioning to delivering funds to your prepaid card, giving you the full set of card usage options. The FCA has confirmed that all cardholder funds are held in full in safeguarded trust accounts and we stand behind our statement that your funds are 100% safe. We will start rolling out this transition later today. We will notify you the moment you have it available.”

The Ranting Pot
thread_text:
06/30/2020 UPDATE: I am now able to use my Payoneer debit card, so it appears that as of 2:30 pm (GMT+2) my funds are unfrozen. Looking for confirmation from others as well.
CONFIRMED: Only users with balance linked to their Payoneer debit cards had their funds frozen. Withdraw to bank seems to work.
Users with NO physical card can use their funds as usual.
EDIT: Latest update from Payonerr courtesy of
@chupavix
:
https://blog.payoneer.com/exclusive/wirecard-prepaid-card-update/ 99
I had my card rejected several times this morning, which of course prompted me to communicate with Payoneer CS.
Their response was that all funds are frozen temporarily by the FCA, the regulator in UK.
The reason being that Wirecard AG (Germany) filed for insolvency.
I had a lot of money in my account, it’s what I use to pay my bills and family’s expenses.
Payoneer is “working on sending out an email to all cardholders.”
Until we learn more about this situation, please avoid sending cleared revenue to your Payoneer cards and do not use the “bank transfer” option either, as that one is being facilitated by Payoneer as well.
I am in shock.
reply_text:
This lady is an awesome spokesperson. Even if I found her breaking into my house, I’d still trust her. She just sounds so sincere.
I’m also pretty pleased with how Payoneer has handled this overall too. They have tried to please everyone, but this can’t have been easy. On Friday, everyone was screaming "WHY DID YOU EVEN USE WIRECARD???" Payoneer says “okay, your funds are safe, now we will look for a new card issuer.” And as they do, everyone starts screaming. "I NEED TO KEEP ON USING MY WIRECARD, IT’S THE ONLY REASON I USE PAYONEER."
And Payoneer calmly says “okay, there’s your Wirecard.”

reply_text:
I don’t think it’s an error on the ATM’s side. I’ve seen multiple reports about the cards working in some places but not the others.
I no longer feel safe using it at all in the physical world, honestly. At least not for the time being. Not sure if it’s a temporary thing or if after imposing such a freeze they can’t figure out how or are unable to lift it completely.
PS According to the facebook group, support is saying that “the system is overload” and they are working hard to fix it. It makes sense, I suppose. Both times my card was declined after things got fixed, I got the same unique error message I did when the funds were frozen. It’s like it randomly reverts to being frozen when it feels like it for now.

reply_text:
So update. I received my paypal cash debit card in the mail yesterday. It’s awesome. ATM fee is just $2. Cheaper than Payoneer. Also with this card, your paypal balance is your card balance. So if you have for example, $500 in your paypal balance, then you have $500 to spend on the card when shopping in store or online.
This means no more waiting 24 hours for money to be transferred from Paypal to Payoneer debit card, or paying $3 for immediate load.
