I also got a notification on Fiverr.


I would also like to mention that the ID that I’d uploaded was not an entirely English document. It had German, English, and French. So, I think Fiverr accepts non-English documents, too.
I did not see any information pertaining to the number of attempts I had available and the deadline for successful verification of ID prior to account suspension. Some users have claimed that you only have 15 days to verify your ID and that you only have 3 attempts. I am not sure if Fiverr has changed this in any way. Or maybe you’re shown that info. only after you fail in verifying your ID? I don’t know.
Please let me know if you have any other questions regarding the ID verification process. I’d be glad to help y’all out.
reply_text: thanks for shearing informational post!

thread_name: SUCCESSFUL Fiverr ID Verification: Here’s what you need to know
categories: Your Fiverr Experience
thread_text:
After having had a very intense/busy last week, I expected today to be a lazy Sunday — one of seclusion and contemplation. But — oh, no! Life would be too easy (too boring even) if everything went your way, am I right? The Fiverr Gods had other plans in store for me.
As soon as I wake up, I usually check my mobile phone for notifications (I have ALL Fiverr notifications enabled, btw). Sometimes, I also open the Fiverr App just in case there is a notification hiding inside the App (sometimes, push notifications can be unreliable ). But, today, I didn’t see anything in the App either.
After making myself some breakfast, I opened Fiverr on my PC. I noticed the characteristic magenta/pink dot by the “Messages.” There were still no notifications on the Fiverr App, though. This struck me as strange. Anyway, when I checked the Fiverr notification on my PC, it was the dreaded “Verify your ID to continue on Fiverr” message. Yep, it appeared as a notification. So, please pay attention to those magenta/pink dots and the message that’s shown!
Since there are hardly any posts (from people who have succeeded in their verification process) detailing the entire verification process, I thought I’d give a very detailed description of my experience. Okay, moving on…
When you click on that notification, it takes you to a page where there is a QR code (which directs you to the ID verification link) as well as an option to get the ID verification link (that the QR code directs you to) sent via e-mail. To be honest, I was under the impression that each seller received a unique link which would only work for that seller. However, it was just a generic link which took you to Fiverr’s ID verification page. This is the link that the QR code, as well as the email, directs you to:
https:// www.fiverr. com/id_verification/info
[Note: Hyperlink has been removed. Please do not go to this web-address if you haven’t yet received a notification to verify your ID. I have only shared this info. so that you understand every step of the process.]
Once you go to that link on your smartphone, you will then be asked to enter your Fiverr login details. The verification process will start as soon as you are logged in.
You can access the above-mentioned link via your PC/tablet/laptop, too. However, I am not sure if accessing that link from such devices would ask you to switch to a smartphone to proceed with the verification process. Fiverr suggests you do the verification process on your smartphone, and that’s how I did mine.
The verification process consists of 2 stages:
Take a photo of your passport/driver’s license/ID.
Take a photo of yourself.
You have the option to either go to the camera App on your phone to take a current photo or to access your photos/files on your phone to upload a pre-existing file/photo from your phone. Before proceeding to the next step in the verification process, you can also retake the photos as many ever times as you want until you are satisfied with the quality of the photo.
Just like how someone had already mentioned in a previous thread 74, you can also upload a pre-existing/pre-scanned photo of your document by clicking on the icon that allows you to access the photos/files on your phone.
I believe the more clear, sharp, focused, and bright (without overexposure, of course) your photos are, the higher is your chance of success.
Therefore, I believe the easiest way to succeed in the verification process is by getting a professionally-made studio-quality photo of your ID and yourself and uploading it during your verification process (by clicking on the icon that allows you to access the photos/files on your phone).
You could also use a scanner to scan your documents, but I believe a professional-quality photo of your ID (taken in a bright environment with diffuse lighting) would have a much higher resolution/quality.
Here’s what I personally did:
I stuck my ID onto the middle of a plain white paper (with double-sided tape). I then turned ALL the lights in my room on to ensure that the room was brightly lit and that the light was very diffuse. This was to ensure that there was no shadow projecting onto the ID while taking its photo. I rested the sheet of paper (with my ID) on a wall and then took a photo. Please make sure that the photo looks sharp and bright. I then uploaded the photo to my PC and edited it further for better brightness and image clarity. I then sent the edited image to my phone and started the verification process. In the first step, I clicked on the icon to access files on my phone and uploaded this edited image of my ID. Despite putting in all the effort to ensure that the edited photo was as bright as possible, the final uploaded image in step 1 looked dull/dark. But that didn’t seem to be an issue.
This is the end of the verification process. You will then get a message saying that Fiverr has received your photos and that they will inform you of the result.
Hardly 5 seconds after that, I got an email saying that I’d successfully verified my ID.

.
.
.
I also got a notification on Fiverr.


I would also like to mention that the ID that I’d uploaded was not an entirely English document. It had German, English, and French. So, I think Fiverr accepts non-English documents, too.
I did not see any information pertaining to the number of attempts I had available and the deadline for successful verification of ID prior to account suspension. Some users have claimed that you only have 15 days to verify your ID and that you only have 3 attempts. I am not sure if Fiverr has changed this in any way. Or maybe you’re shown that info. only after you fail in verifying your ID? I don’t know.
Please let me know if you have any other questions regarding the ID verification process. I’d be glad to help y’all out.
reply_text: N/A

reply_text:
(Put it at the beginning, I’m not a English native speaker hahahh:) )
Currently I received the verify ID request and I’m definitely afraid of my account being forbidden . I just came here for less than a month and haven’t withdraw my earning for one time!! Finally it’s successful and I’m really breath out so. I tried for two times. First time I signed in via Google account. I also found a bug there that I just can’t successfully sign in by inputting my definitely right User name/Email address and password, I even changed my password once time to prove that! Very annoying , but with luck, the Google account worked well. Then I can’t find any entry button to click to the photo roll and only can make a live photograph (I use iPhone se). I shot the scanning version of my Chinese id card and a studio-made formal profile picture on my iPad with the back camera(12 Mp). After submitting, no any response appear in my email box for nearly an hour, so I think my fist time was failed (not even a inform for the fail) and I decided to try one more time. I think maybe the AI verify technology would not accept the scanning version on my another device so this time I use the raw front camera for my selfie(very casual, didn’t redo much time, and the camera quality is 1.2 Mp ). Back camera for the real ID card, note that having completely no shadow on your avatar because maybe the comparison is mostly made between this photo and your selfie. Then submitted it , for waiting a few more seconds, I received the excited email informing that my verify information has been accepted!! That was really an exciting experience and thanks for the fiverr system to protect our community atmosphere.
Then I can continue my great Monday.
(Wuhan Fighting!(Against the corona virus!))

thread_name: The byer wants me to sign on a paper…Need your advice!
categories: Your Fiverr Experience
thread_text:
Hello. I need your advice.
I just completed my first order but after I deliver my work and complete the order, the buyer send me a paper and he wants me to sign on it. The paper includes DESCRIPTION OF SERVICES / RIGHTS OWNERSHIP / CONFIDENTIALITY and so on.
Is this normal? Does it happen often?
There is a column for my name and my address.
I um uncomfortable with this and I think at least he should have sent it before this order starts.
What do you think??
reply_text:
I think if the order have been completed, you can ignore the buyer,
or simply copy this " Fiverr disallow sharing any personal information of seller, doing it may result in permanent ban for both accounts"

thread_name: The byer wants me to sign on a paper…Need your advice!
categories: Your Fiverr Experience
thread_text:
Hello. I need your advice.
I just completed my first order but after I deliver my work and complete the order, the buyer send me a paper and he wants me to sign on it. The paper includes DESCRIPTION OF SERVICES / RIGHTS OWNERSHIP / CONFIDENTIALITY and so on.
Is this normal? Does it happen often?
There is a column for my name and my address.
I um uncomfortable with this and I think at least he should have sent it before this order starts.
What do you think??
reply_text:
Advise your seller to read the ToS as ordering from Fiverr covers him for all of that.
An order means he has rights, ownership and confidentiality. An order IS a contract.
He obviously isn’t a competent buyer. In no business does a contract of confidentiality and ownership come after a contract is agreed to by both parties and the work has been completed and paid for.

So i have a video editing gig on which there is 1.9k impressions ,and 1k clicks and two cancellation on that gig.
can someone tell me that how much impressions and clicks require for rank in top page.

Please tell me the way so that i can rank my gig on top page.

reply_text: Nobody can say for sure what it takes to make it to the first page and stay there. If they claim to know how it’s done, they’re either misinformed, lying, or a myth chaser.

categories:
Your Fiverr Experience
My Fiverr Gigs
thread_text:
What a way to increase gig inspiration
#My Gig inspiration is very low.
reply_text: Create your own pages/channels on social media and promote yourself in it. Don’t use any local groups/pages to promote your service and don’t even post in those groups regarding your promotion.

thread_name: Indian Fiverr - PayPal or Bank Transfer?
categories:
Your Fiverr Experience
Conversations
thread_text:
Hello Indian Fiverrers,
I was reviewing my pay out method and looking forward to know what you guys prefer.
I always used to use PayPal but thinking to shift to Bank Transfer now.
Here’s a rough calculation that made me think about trying Bank Transfer. Let me know if I am short of knowledge about this.
Let’s take $1000 payout as example:
1) PayPal option:
PayPal to Bank ($999 @ 61.84/-) = INR 61778.16
2) Bank Transfer Option:
Net USD transfered = $1000 @ 62 (approx) = INR 62,000.00
Is there any other hidden charges I am missing out?
reply_text: But I don’t think so, I am using paypal and it only charge $1 per withdrawl

reply_text: The PayPal 4.4% + $0.30 fee is applicable if you do any direct sales or get money directly from clients or if someone sends you money directly to PayPal account. So, only $1 will be get deducted.

categories:
Your Fiverr Experience
Conversations
thread_text:

2) Bank Transfer Option:

Is there any other hidden charges I am missing out?
reply_text:
Indian sellers using PayPal to withdraw money from fiverr are at loss.
Payoneer is free for India and there are no charges for withdrawal through it. The information provided on fiverr website about 3$ per transaction does not apply to sellers in India.
Your PayPal calculations look more or less accurate, I don’t use it for fiverr but clients with whom I work directly, the charges are as you said. Below is an image which shows the net amount I received on 20$ withdrawal.
This below image is for fiverr withdrawal through Payoneer - Withdrawal amount was 960$
PayPal is a bad idea for Indian sellers due to always low conversion rate than Payoneer. The transactions are also a lot faster for Payoneer.
The only disadvantage for Payoneer is when you work with clients directly.

reply_text:
I have noticed that if you withdraw before 1 or 2 hours when they send email that money is transferred to your bank account, normally you will receive email on 10.40 am and 1 pm then you receive money in your account by 5 PM, maximum 6 PM.
So at the very last it you withdraw money at or before 12 pm then you would get it till 6 PM…
So in short, if you withdraw before 12 pm you would get it the same day, else it would be transferred the next day.
P.S: Indian Time is mentioned.

There was no fees till march, so I transfer regularly any amount more than $20. But on my last transcation, I saw that Payoneer is deducting a flat $3. If you transfer $20 (min) you’ll get $17, if you transfer $100 you’ll get $97. Now I think it’s better to move PayPal again.

thread_name: Indian Fiverr - PayPal or Bank Transfer?
categories:
Your Fiverr Experience
Conversations
thread_text:
Hello Indian Fiverrers,
I was reviewing my pay out method and looking forward to know what you guys prefer.
I always used to use PayPal but thinking to shift to Bank Transfer now.
Here’s a rough calculation that made me think about trying Bank Transfer. Let me know if I am short of knowledge about this.
Let’s take $1000 payout as example:
1) PayPal option:
PayPal to Bank ($999 @ 61.84/-) = INR 61778.16
2) Bank Transfer Option:
Net USD transfered = $1000 @ 62 (approx) = INR 62,000.00
Is there any other hidden charges I am missing out?
reply_text:
@bigvee
Is there any other charges other that $3 if there is only $3 and if we were trying to withdraw more than $500 because of PayPal’s conversion rate is less than Payoneer. Or you suggest something if you have something to share

Yes, I guess PayPal provides 7% less conversion rate from the current currency rate, So, for big amount Payoneer is better,
Here is the example
if we withdraw from Payoneer $1000 to INR we will be received 74,235INR ( conversion rate:75.9826INR against 1USD) this price include $3 charges & 2% conversion rate
and if we withdraw from PayPal $1000 we will receive 70663.818( as PayPal provide 7% less conversio )
Thanks

thread_text: Hey, I’m Ana! I am new to Fiverr and currently have a few gigs, and it would mean a lot to me if you checked them out! I understand that you’re probably thinking “Why in the world would I trust a stranger on the internet?” and you know what, you’re right. However, there is something reassuring about the fact that I could assist in not only making your vision come alive but also earn your trust considering that we don’t have presumptions towards each other.

thread_text:
Hi, im having this problem on my gig page since 4 days it says ‘‘We’re working on getting your Gigs’ impressions, clicks, and views back online. No worries - your Gigs are active, and all the metrics are calculated as usual.’’
I want to know if im the only one who have this problem and when should it be fixed
reply_text:
Oh come on, seriously?
I know that I’m getting overly emotional but it’s quite annoying because every second post on this forum for the last week is about this impressions showing zero.
It’s quite disrespectful to ask us to invest our time into answering your question when we already answered it so many times and you didn’t even put an effort into scrolling down “latest post”.
But shortly: yes, everyone has that bug, everyone has their gig stats NA.

reply_text: I have been on fiverr for years, there are days when I get 5 or 6 inquiries and then there are weeks when I get nothing. In the down periods, I make better cards, I try to work on my gigs, I update them with the best examples I have. I take the time to make sure the gigs thumbnail really pops in the search. I rarely see buyer requests and even if i do, I’m never chosen due to the massive competition from higher level sellers who obviously have more reviews and have made more sales. I don’t know what to do anymore… Sigh…
reply_text:
Marketing Yourself - Just Do It - Here's How - UPYOUR
Tips for Sellers
In my recent poll, the following results occurred. 51% of us admitted “I do not do enough marketing” 30% of us know/believe “I do not show up in search results” Only 12% of us have “got an order from a client I brought to Fiverr myself” Only 10% of us have “got an order from a client through social media” 7% said “Our marketing is not working even though I spend time and money on it” It is clear that we need to do more ourselves to build our business and increase our sales. If you read the fo…

categories:
Your Fiverr Experience
Improve My Gig
thread_text: Hey guys! It’s been 2 months already yet I haven’t made a single sale. I’ve tried everything. From optimizing my gig to always staying online. I rarely see buyer requests and even if i do, I’m never chosen due to the massive competition from higher level sellers who obviously have more reviews and have made more sales. I don’t know what to do anymore… Sigh…
reply_text:
What you describe as your efforts are just tricks that don’t work.
You need to research how markets work and create something that fills a gap in the market and that people actually want. THAT is what gets orders. People don’t start wanting what you sell because certain tags and stayed online all the time.
Do you buy things just because the seller used a certain keyword? No, you buy it because you want it and it’s an exceptional option with little competition.
Stop thinking that tricks make people want what you sell. Find something that doesn’t have high competition for which you are exceptional and serve a niche.

categories:
Your Fiverr Experience
Improve My Gig
thread_text:
Hey,
It’s Kashif here, I just completed my first order on fiver and the buyer give me a rating of 4.3 because of which I’m not able to send the buyer requests as I’m new so my gig may not rank.
can you guys suggest what to do now?
fiver link: https://www.fiverr.com/kashifshah64?up_rollout=true 2
reply_text:
You can’t ask buyer for any rating, either positive or negative. Doing that, will get your account a warning letter.
And the rating is permanent, you cant ask buyer to change it .
A 4.3 star rating is not bad, not a negative rating either.

thread_name: How can I improve my gigs sale?
categories:
Your Fiverr Experience
Improve My Gig
thread_text: How can i improve my gigs sales in Fiverr?
reply_text:
You only have 31 minutes of read-time shown in your forum profile. Check out the Tips For Sellers category (forum.fiverr.com/c/Fiverr-Tips/tips-for-sellers/l/top/all?order=views). You’ll find hundreds of threads offering advice on a variety of things to consider and/or improve. (Note: Not all advice can apply to all gigs or categories. Be sure you check multiple sources as there are some false tips, even among the top threads.)
It takes a lot of work to make it as a freelancer, so be sure to research and plan accordingly.
“If you fail to plan, you are planning to fail.” (Attributed to Benjamin Franklin)
Specific to your gig, please see (CPM) point 2:
Basics to Improve Your Gig. A helpful breakdown and guide
Tips for Sellers
Introduction – This is not a list on how to make gigs. This is for gigs that are already made that are under-performing, need an overhaul, or just need somewhere to start for self-evaluation/education. It does contain a few general-information bits, and can help during gig creation, but that is neither the focus nor the intent. For more information on any of the following sections or points, please see ‘Other Resources’ under (RRD) at the end of this post. Sections: (TCT) Title, Category, and…
There are also a bunch of useful links in the (RRD) section.

thread_name: I am totally new at this platform need suggestion
categories:
Your Fiverr Experience
My Fiverr Gigs
fiverr.com
thread_text:
https://www.fiverr.com/kesharbisht/design-your-vision-and-imagination 2
https://www.fiverr.com/kesharbisht/convert-your-raster-image-or-sketch-to-vector-or-hd-image
reply_text:
If you’re “totally new to this platform”, why did you make a thread to give advice?
What is with this phenomenon of sellers with no sales giving advice – and that advice is always super generic, basic and repetitive?
My advice is this: create gigs that don’t have dozens of thousands of competitors on Fiverr alone. You are a needle in a haystack and you won’t stand out with your portfolio as it is, anyway. Literally thousands of other people are doing the same here. Research your competition before you create a gig or modify it.

reply_text:
Hey,
How’s it going?
Welcome to the Fiverr community,
there’s nothing you can do to control the buyer requests that you’re getting unless you try offering a different service but that’s the only thing that I can think of. So if you’re not seeing any buyer requests everyday then I don’t think there is anything you can do about that unfortunately.
Good luck

muchas gracias!
reply_text:
Hi Lucy
Fiverr is an English speaking platform. All posts, profiles and gigs must have, at the very least, an English translation available.
That would be the reason for your issues with the site.

thread_text: I am newbie to fiverr , please explain me what is actually buyers request?
reply_text:
go to your fiverr profile. Looks right on top menu. “More” click on that for buyer request. Everyday u can send 10 buyer request. Buyer request is buyer post a job project, where every seller can apply for project.
If you apply on the Job project with proper maner then it will help you to hiree you on that job.
Hope you clear now

On the other side, this buyer has taken things and saying I knew those things already, so basically everything he’s getting for free…
reply_text:
What is the service/product you sold them?
It is very black and white in the ToS - a buyer may not use the work you send them unless the order is accepted and paid for in full.
It can be hard to prove they’ve used your work depending on the type of gig, but if you can prove they used it you will have a right to pursue legal action.

My buyer isn’t happy with the final work I delivered and asking me to cancel the order.
I’m thinking can’t he cancel the order or maybe order cancellation option isn’t available to him? He should do it from his end or asking me is fine?
On the other side, this buyer has taken things and saying I knew those things already, so basically everything he’s getting for free…
reply_text: Agree - of course, we don’t know the whole situation in details, but if work was made really good, according to requirements, so let him contact the Fiverr team. They will see the situation and solve it

“Cancel the order or else I will leave a bad review and contact the Fiverr team”
Okay, now that is against the ToS.
For your consideration:

categories:
Your Fiverr Experience
Improve My Gig
thread_text:
I have a gig I made two months ago, and just want some feedback on how I can make it better, and how I can continue to grow possibly beyond Fiverr.
Thanks,
Avi
https://www.fiverr.com/avikviolin/teach-your-kids-how-to-code
reply_text:
Important: Fiverr Sends A Lot Of Mixed Messages 1
You have a good start. You need to remove the stars before you get in trouble.
You also mentioned in a previous thread that you were considering making a video to introduce yourself and your gig. Did you change your mind?
I’ve gathered a bunch of useful links in the (RRD) section at the end of this thread. Basics to Improve Your Gig. A helpful breakdown and guide

categories:
Your Fiverr Experience
Improve My Gig
thread_text:
I have a gig I made two months ago, and just want some feedback on how I can make it better, and how I can continue to grow possibly beyond Fiverr.
Thanks,
Avi
https://www.fiverr.com/avikviolin/teach-your-kids-how-to-code
reply_text: Oh my god thanks so much. Just removed the stars. Yeah I am pretty young and I’m afraid that may scare people off. I personally hold the belief that as a student myself, I can connect better with younger students compared to an adult, but I still think a lot of people don’t realize. Hopefully I’ll do it at some point.

or whatever you are, I was never and will never think what you think I thought when I typed my remarks. My mind doesn’t work like that. I know I make mistakes in my grammar. And I know I can not spot them sometimes. It is human nature. It is not a mistake we should be embarrassed or trade we should be ashamed of. If I send Vickie my file she would spot mistakes in a heartbeat, and if she sends me hers it would happen the same, but if we sit in front of our own papers and gaze for hours we could not spot them.

categories: Your Fiverr Experience
thread_text: What does “no level” mean? The sleeper I bought from has about 2k reviews. Has been a seller for a few years but doesn’t have a level? Is this a scam or are these all fake reviews. I’m kind of confused. I’m afraid I got scammed.
reply_text:
We have a few different levels: No Level, Level 1, Level 2 and Top Rated Seller.
Evaluations are monthly and you can be promoted or demoted depending on your metrics on the previous 60 days.
So it’s possible to be a really competent and successful seller and hold a no level status. I wouldn’t worry about your seller being a scam as buying 2k reviews is just not feasible.
You can read more about seller level here: https://www.fiverr.com/levels 1

categories: Your Fiverr Experience

reply_text: Ok great. Thank you. I feel better about the situation.

Thats an interesting point!
Imagine being so successful and getting so many orders that you end up losing your levels!

thread_name: How can I start getting orders again?
categories:
Your Fiverr Experience
Improve My Gig
thread_text: Hello highly esteemed experts, I joined fiverr in april and I had 12 orders in my first 30 days. But for the past two months, I haven’t had any order. Please I need your help. This is the link to my account; www.fiverr.com/magikpen 3. Your advices will be highly appreciated. Best regards.
reply_text:
You only have 1 hour of read-time shown in your forum profile. Check out the Tips For Sellers category (forum.fiverr.com/c/Fiverr-Tips/tips-for-sellers/l/top/all?order=views). You’ll find hundreds of threads offering advice on a variety of things to consider and/or improve. (Note: Not all advice can apply to all gigs or categories. Be sure you check multiple sources as there are some false tips, even among the top threads.)
It takes a lot of work to make it as a freelancer, so be sure to research and plan accordingly.
“If you fail to plan, you are planning to fail.” (Attributed to Benjamin Franklin)
Specific to your gig, please see (DES) point 1 and (PRF) point 3:
Basics to Improve Your Gig. A helpful breakdown and guide
Tips for Sellers
Introduction – This is not a list on how to make gigs. This is for gigs that are already made that are under-performing, need an overhaul, or just need somewhere to start for self-evaluation/education. It does contain a few general-information bits, and can help during gig creation, but that is neither the focus nor the intent. For more information on any of the following sections or points, please see ‘Other Resources’ under (RRD) at the end of this post. Sections: (TCT) Title, Category, and…
There are also a bunch of useful links in the (RRD) section.

categories: Your Fiverr Experience
thread_text:
i bought backlinks for my site ******. as a result the spam score of my site was increased by huge number. it is effecting my ranking in search engine. what should i do now?
Mod Note: Outgoing link removed.
reply_text: If your dodgy links have increased spam score or lowered domain authority, you can attempt to disavow them. Sadly, buying backlinks can have this effect, particularly if you’re going for quantity over quality. A handful of good, genuine links is always better than a hundred links from unrelated, spammy sites. Good luck, I hope you can fix it soon
